channel.title: Mopar Server Status Help!
channel.description:
When i post my server on mopar server status, it says the server is offline.'
I have: - Port forwarded and whatnot - Turned off Windows firewall - Turned off Norton Firewall
What could possibly be wrong? :|

item.title: Mopar Server Status Help!
item.dc:creator: @izin8r2296 izin8r2296
item.description:
@izin8r2296 wrote:

I know. And I put heaps of work into my server

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar Server Status Help!
item.dc:creator: @n33bz0rpl0x `Aaron
item.description:
@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

[quote=“izin8r2296, post:9, topic:292663”][quote author=Aeolian. link=topic=386651.msg2897298#msg2897298 date=1249291289]
What Router are you useing , and how did you portforward
[/quote]
I am using a DIR-300 D-Link router, and I went into Advanced\Portforwarding, then allowed 43594 for TCP

It’s better if you state EVERY detail. If you haven’t recently made your no-ip, go to www.no-ip.com, manage hosts, and click “update” it basically updates your ip-address again. If you haven’t done this try it and tell me.

Yep, did that, won’t work still :@[/quote]

that’s odd, something isn’t right.

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar Server Status Help!
item.dc:creator: @izin8r2296 izin8r2296
item.description:
@izin8r2296 wrote:

Aeolian.:

What Router are you useing , and how did you portforward

I am using a DIR-300 D-Link router, and I went into Advanced\Portforwarding, then allowed 43594 for TCP

n33bz0rpl0x:

It’s better if you state EVERY detail. If you haven’t recently made your no-ip, go to www.no-ip.com, manage hosts, and click “update” it basically updates your ip-address again. If you haven’t done this try it and tell me.

Yep, did that, won’t work still :@

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar Server Status Help!
item.dc:creator: @n33bz0rpl0x `Aaron
item.description:
@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

[quote=“izin8r2296, post:6, topic:292663”][quote author=izin8r2296 link=topic=386651.msg2897267#msg2897267 date=1249290349]

  • Port forwarded and whatnot
    [/quote]

Yep[/quote]

It’s better if you state EVERY detail. If you haven’t recently made your no-ip, go to www.no-ip.com, manage hosts, and click “update” it basically updates your ip-address again. If you haven’t done this try it and tell me.

Read full topic

item.title: Mopar Server Status Help!
item.dc:creator: @izin8r2296 izin8r2296
item.description:
@izin8r2296 wrote:

[quote=“Aeolian., post:2, topic:292663”]Lol thats the funnyiest thing ive ever heard.

“Turned Off Firewall”

Your gunna get trogans and leachers,

there was no point in turning off ur firewall, you portforward and your server is offline;

but you never said u hade a source so that might be ur problem[/quote]

I do have a source, I was turning off the firewalls to try to narrow down the problem to somewhere

[quote=“n33bz0rpl0x, post:3, topic:292663”][quote author=izin8r2296 link=topic=386651.msg2897267#msg2897267 date=1249290349]
When i post my server on mopar server status, it says the server is offline.’

I have:

  • Port forwarded and whatnot
  • Turned off Windows firewall
  • Turned off Norton Firewall

What could possibly be wrong?
[/quote]

You didn’t mention that you have your no-ip. Have you registered it at www.No-ip.com ?[/quote]

Yep, I do have a No-Ip. That didn’t work, so I tried my real IP, and that didn’t work either.

Read full topic
